page.title: 07Belchamps Scout/guide Camp.
page.content: {Belchamps}is situated in Holyoak Lane, Hawkwell and is owned by the Scout's and Guide's Associations. It was founded in 1936 and cost Â£600 at that time.The money was raised by the Boy Scouts Association.The warden's name is Mr.John Buxton. Belchamps is French for beautiful fields. It covers 28 acres of fields and woodland and is used for camping and other activities like orienteering, pioneering, archery, nature trails etc. It has an open air Chapel made out of logs and branches, with a wooden cross above the entrance. They have a service on Sunday mornings for the Scouts, Cubs and Guides. The Chapel was dedicated by the Archdeacon in !938. There is also a Camp Fire Circle, which was dug out manually by teams of Scouts and Rovers. Many people give up their time to make Belchamps a place to enjoy.
